titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Richard Keith Culver Drawings, ca. 1888-1905 M0313

change.item: <date calendar="gregorian" normal="20040323" era="ce">March 23, 2004</date><item>PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Libraries::Dept. of Special Collections::Manuscripts Division//TEXT (US::CSt::M313::Richard Keith Culver Drawings)//EN" "m0313.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).</item>

did.unittitle: Richard Keith Culver Drawings

repository.corpname: Dept. of Special Collections & University Archives

did.physloc: Special Collections and University Archives materials are stored offsite and must be paged 36-48 hours in advance. For more information on paging collections, see the department's website: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/spc.html.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was a gift of William Wreden to Stanford University, Special Collections in 1979.

scopecontent.head: SCOPE AND CONTENT
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of drawings by Culver used in comic strips, broadsides, satire cartoons, and calendars with some drawings by other artists, newsclippings about Culver, and several publications which contain Culver illustrations.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHY
bioghist.p: Richard Keith Culver received his A.B. in bionomics in 1899 from Stanford University. He was a nationally syndicated cartoonist before becoming a citrus grower in 1931.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Richard Keith Culver Drawings, M0313, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights:
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research use. Materias must be requested at least 36 hours in advance of intended use. Audio-visual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

Scrapbook - "Caricatures by R.K. Culver." Newspaper clips of caricatures by Culver as well as a couple of large broadsheets. Miscellaneous news clippings of Culver, as well as other artists' cartoons. One photo "Zim - Judge" to Mr. R. K. Culver of California
